quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Following and Type
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, people, breed. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: It has been estimated that in Australia, there are about twice as many kangaroos as there are people.
Which of the following is not a type of chipmunk?
What is the fastest animal on 6 legs?
Which of the following is not a type of spider?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Glass spider

questions.question: Sheep are similar to cows in that they have a stomach which contains four chambers.
What is the white tigers scientific name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Panthera tigris

questions.question: What is a female sheep called or known as?
Which of these is not a type of beetle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Burrowing beetle

questions.question: Can tigers live to be 20 years old?
Which of these is not an actual breed of sheep?
Which of the following is not a breed of dog?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ferret terrier

questions.question: All but one of the following are true types of bears. Which is the odd one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moon bear

questions.question: One of these is not a true breed of cat. Which one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: French Twist

questions.question: Which of these is not an actual breed of horse?
All tigers have stripes.

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Breed and Lions
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, males, chicken. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the breed of animal created from the crossing of a female lion and a male tiger?
There are more males then females in a pride.
One of these is not a true breed of chicken. Which one?
What is the average lifespan of a lion living in the wild?
Cats twitch the tips of their tails slightly when hunting or when angry, while stronger twitching indicates what?
How many different vocalization sounds does a cat make?
Cats generally purr when they are happy, but they can also be heard purring in what other situation?

options.text: When they are distressed or in pain
When they are hunting or playing
When they are hungry or thirsty
When they are lonely or angry

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: When they are distressed or in pain

questions.question: Generally, how many times in an interval of 5 hours do lions mate?
If a cat pushes its face against your head, this means what?
What do male lions have which females do not possess?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A mane

questions.question: Female lions hunt in a group.
What is a group of lions called?
Which of the following is not a breed of pig?
What is the breed of animal created from the crossing of a male lion and a female tiger?
Are male lions are generally stronger then female lions?

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Pound and Cats
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, people, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: A cats front paws have 5 toes and their back paws have 4.
Human beings have 23 pairs of  chromosomes. Which animal has the most chromosomes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: hermit crabs

questions.question: Which of these animals has the largest paws?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An average lynx

questions.question: How do scientists calculate the age of a fish?

options.text: They count all the teeth in the fishs mouth.
They measure the size of the fish and compare that to the average size of that type of  fish.
They count the growth rings on the ear bone.
They count the teeth in the fishs lower lip.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They count the growth rings on the ear bone.

questions.question: What is the name of the first book by Darwin that directly dealt with evolution?

options.text: Essay on the Principles of Population
On the Origins of the Species
The Descent of Man and the Selection in Relation to Sex

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: On the Origins of the Species

questions.question: All pigs are classified as un-Kosher meaning they can not be eaten by Jewish people.
Pound for pound, humans are not the strongest animals. What is considered the strongest species, pound for pound?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hercules beetle

questions.question: What was the largest  eagle ever found on Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Haasts Eagle

questions.question: Which term refers to the group formed by frogs and amphibians?
Sharks can only be found in salt water.
What type of animal is a lamprey?
Which statement about elephants is untrue?

options.text: There are some pink elephants in India
Elephants do not have great memories

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elephants do not have great memories

questions.question: All cats are born with green eyes.
The smallest species of shark in the world is the Dwarf Lanternfish.
What is alektorophobia?

options.text: The unreasonable fear of birds of prey

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The unreasonable fear of chickens

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Chihuahuas and Sharks
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, chihuahuas, rays. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Chihuahuas are the only dogs to be born with what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An incomplete skull

questions.question: The Chihuahua is the smallest dog breed in the world.
Sharks are immune to cancer.
The dogfish is actually a common species of small shark.
Despite the myth that Chihuahuas were descendants of the royal dog of the Aztecs, it is also believed that Spanish trade merchants brought Chihuahuas to which of these countries?
Sharks have poor vision.
More shark attacks occur during the day than at night.
What maximum height at the withers can Chihuahuas reach?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 15 inches (38 cm)

questions.question: Rays and Skates are types of sharks.
What is the average lifespan of Chihuahuas?
Sharks can have up to nine gills on each side of their body.
If attacked by a shark it is recommended that you punch the shark in the nose.
The Chihuahua Gidget is famous for what reason?

options.text: Paris Hilton has it as a pet.
It was a fill-in mascot for the Georgia Bulldogs.
It was a mascot for Taco Bell.
It was a mascot for Taco John.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was a mascot for Taco Bell.

questions.question: Chihuahuas come in three colors: brindle, black, and camel.
Sharks must eat continually in order to survive.

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Sea and Worms
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, chihuahuas, pincers. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: These worms are not in fact worms, but bivalves. They enter wood as larvae, where they remain and grow, burrowing through the wood.
The Pacific lobster has large pincers and a spiny shell.
The Spectacled bear makes its habitat around the Andes tropical basin.
Squid and octopus are mollusks.
How long in years is the life span of an average wild hippopotamus?
This is the basic food of the sea. Billions upon billions of these organisms live in the sea.
Hippos are related to cetaceans (whales and porpoises).
What does the word “hippopotamus” mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: River horse

questions.question: This crab is not really a crab, but an arthropod. Its closest relative is the spider.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Horseshoe crab

questions.question: This is the result of the gravitational pull from the moon and sun.

options.text: Migration of certain species of whales

questions.question: Chihuahuas are prone to hypoglycemia (low blood sugar).
Hippos secrete a red substance known as blood sweat that protects them from the sun.
For their size hippos are pretty fast runners and are much faster than humans.
This sea animal, widely considered the most valuable shellfish, is common in shallow, warmer waters of all oceans.
These creatures look like flowers as they grow attached to rocks. Their tentacles open like fleshy petals and contract whenever danger is near.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sea Anemones

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Australia and Animal
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, weight, kangaroo. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This Australian monotreme lays eggs and has a remarkable sense of electroception.
Also called Sea Biscuit, this animal lives in deeper water half-buried in the sand.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sand Dollar

questions.question: The diet of the koala consists mainly of what plant species?
The venomous lizard Gila monster was named after what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Gila River basin

questions.question: What is the average weight of the Tasmanian Pygmy Possum?
Which of these mammals was brought to Australia by humans?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The dingo

questions.question: The Komodo dragon, the largest living lizard on Earth, lives in which part of the world?
Which of the following statements about echidnas, mammals native to Australia, is wrong?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Echidnas are marsupials.

questions.question: Which lizard can squirt blood from the corners of its eyes in order to confuse and drive back its enemies?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Horned lizard

questions.question: Qantas, Australias largest airline company, has what Australian animal on its red-and-white logo?
The red kangaroo appears on the Coat of Arms of Australia together with what other endemic Australian animal?
Which Australian animal is the largest living carnivorous marsupial on Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Tasmanian devil

questions.question: Which one of these Australian reptiles is the largest living crocodile in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The saltwater crocodile

questions.question: Which term refers to the self-defense mechanism which allows lizards to break off their tails when captured?
What is the difference between the male and the female Galah, a cockatoo bird native to Australia?

options.text: There is no difference between them.
Males and females have different eye colour.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Males and females have different eye colour.
